title: Enhance website layout and adjust top-right navigation link styling

requirements.text: Update the desktop header navigation so the Home/About/Services/Contact menu is positioned on the top-right side of the header (to the right of the logo) and appears slightly larger than it is now.

quotes: WE WANT MORE elaborate Website THE HOME,ABOUT, SERVICE,CONTACT MOVE RIGHT ON TOP DASHBOARD SILGHTLY BIG AND BASED ON LINK MODE

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths (md and up), the navigation links render aligned to the right side of the header area.
Navigation link text is visibly larger than the current `text-sm` styling (e.g., `text-base` or equivalent), while remaining responsive and not wrapping unexpectedly.
No layout overlap occurs between the logo/company name and the navigation items at common viewport widths.

requirements.text: Change the Home/About/Services/Contact navigation to a clear "link mode" presentation: links should look and behave like navigation links (not button-like), including hover styling and an active/selected state that reflects the currently viewed section while scrolling.
acceptanceCriteria: Desktop nav items are styled as links (e.g., underline/indicator on hover and active) rather than button-like UI.
As the user scrolls through the single-page sections (`home`, `about`, `services`, `contact`), the corresponding nav item reflects an active state.
Clicking a nav link still smooth-scrolls to the correct section (existing behavior preserved).

requirements.text: Make the overall website more elaborate while keeping the same single-page structure and the same top-level sections (Home, About, Services, Contact), by enhancing visual hierarchy, spacing, and section presentation (e.g., improved hero composition, section separators/background treatments, and more polished card/typography rhythm).
acceptanceCriteria: The Home, About, Services, and Contact sections remain present and reachable via the header navigation.
Each section shows a noticeable increase in visual richness (improved spacing, typography hierarchy, and/or decorative layout elements) without adding new top-level pages.
Mobile responsiveness is maintained (no horizontal overflow; content remains readable and properly spaced on small screens).

requirements.text: Apply one cohesive visual theme across the site (colors, typography, layout accents) and enforce it consistently across header, sections, and footer.
acceptanceCriteria: Header, section blocks, and footer share consistent styling decisions (typography scale, spacing, and accent usage).
Theme is implemented using existing Tailwind/CSS variable approach and does not introduce inconsistent one-off styles across sections.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep the app as a single-page layout with smooth scrolling between existing section IDs (`home`, `about`, `services`, `contact`).
nonGoals: Adding backend functionality or persistence (backend canister is currently empty).
Introducing additional top-level pages/routes beyond the existing single-page sections.
Integrating third-party services (analytics, CRM, email delivery) for the contact form.
